dialogues.text: Hey bug, come here. We're watching "Locked Up Abroad: Uganda."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw it.    It was gnarly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay's. Jules and Nic shoot each other a concerned look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be back late, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I have a hug before you go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a quick one.   Please!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hug her.    That's what she's there for. Laser leaves.   Nic hits mute on the TV, looks at Jules.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ugh. Maybe we should just sit him down and ask him already.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?    "Are you and Clay fucking?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Exploring" is the word I'd use...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what if he is "exploring?" This is the age for that. Why should we care? NIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We shouldn't... (then) I just don't understand why he's exploring with that loser. JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, we don't even know what the deal is. We're jumping to conclusions. NIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel like he has so much potential and he's just wasting it. Nic's comment hits a nerve in Jules. JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you trying to say? NIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, what am I trying to say? JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It feels like there's some subtext here. NIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know: Like mother like son? Is that it? Both of us aimless, wandering in the darkness, "wasting our potential?" Nic won't go there. NIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, honey, you're on a whole other tangent and I have no idea what you're talking about. JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, maybe it hasn't risen to the plane of consciousness for you yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.   Maybe not. Nic clicks the volume back on, freezing Jules out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 34 Paul and Tanya sit at the bar, eating family-meal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what were they like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweet. They were really good kids. The boy's kind of a sensitive jock and the girl's kind of innocent but whip-smart and super cute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like you connected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, we kinda did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you leave it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We didn't really leave it anywhere. Brooke, the sexy Wiccan volunteer, comes up to Paul beari basket of freshly-picked fruits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Paul. Paul leans over the basket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatcha got? Oh cool. First strawberries of the season.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't they look awesome? I thought you should have the first taste. And with that, she smiles, hands him the basket and leave

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mimicking Brooke)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "I thought you should have the first taste...of my pussy." Paul can't help smiling at the nasty talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 35 Clay rummages through the top drawer of Jules' dresser. Laser stands behind him, uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, I don't think they smoke pot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold up. Clay freezes. CLOSE ON a row of sex toys including a fanc pink, Japanese "all-in-one" dildo and a few DVD's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa! Clay turns on the dildo.      It starts to gyrate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, it's alive!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, put it back!! Laughing, Clay throws the dildo back in the drawer.    Th grabs one of the DVDs and spins back around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, we're watching this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 36 Laser and Clay sit on the bed.     They look at each othe Then Laser hits play.

dialogues.speaker: ON SCREEN
dialogues.text: We see a COP giving a young MAN a BLOW-JOB. Laser and Cla sit motionless, shocked, disgusted, riveted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think the whole thing's like this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want me to fast-forward? Clay doesn't answer.    They just keep watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 39 Jules pulls her truck into the driveway, almost running o Laser's bike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 40 Laser and Clay are still watching the porn...as Jules wal in the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laser, you left your bike out... Laser reflexively grabs for the remote. As he fumbles for it, Jules sees what they're watching. She looks mortified

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 41 We enter a family conference already in progress. Nic and Jules act calm but are inwardly mortified that th 15-year-old son found their porn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laser, your mom and I accept you and love you unconditionally? You know that, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you know you can be open with us about anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LASER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know. Jules steels herself for a frank discussion. JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laser, is there anything you want to talk about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything.     Anything on your mind. Laser cracks his knuckles. LASER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well there is something. Nic and Jules share a look.      "Here we go." LASER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's more of a question, really. NIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's okay. JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We won't judge you. Laser looks at his moms.       Nic and Jules brace themse LASER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you guys watch gay man-porn? Nic and Jules look at each other, thrown. NIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, first I have to say we rarely watch that movie-- Jules touches Nic's arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey... NIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And secondly, I really don't appreciate you snooping around our room. Was that Clay's idea? I have to say again, I don't like him. He seems untended...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, that's not what he asked-- NIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snapping) Fine. Do you want to answer his question?! JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, sweetie, human sexuality is complicated. And sometimes, people's desires can be...counter- intuitive... (soldiering on) For instance, since women's sexual responsiveness is mostly internal, sometimes it's exciting for us to see sexual responsiveness more, you know... (beat) ...externalized. Laser looks at them, still baffled. JULES (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like with a penis. LASER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But like, wouldn't you rather watch two women doing it? JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You would think that. But in most of those movies, they've hired two straight women to pretend and the inauthenticity is just unbeara-- NIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, that's enough! Laser, your mom and I have a sense there's some other stuff going on in your life and we just want to be let in. LASER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean? JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you having a relationship with someone? NIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could tell us, honey. We'd understand and support you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laser looks confused.   How did they find out about Paul?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just met him once. Nic and Jules share a worried look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean once?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he find you on-line?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who did you meet once?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul!    I met him with Joni.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's Paul?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why was Joni there?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She set it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget the set-up!   Who is Paul?!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our sperm donor. Jules and Nic go white.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, did you guys think I was gay?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 42 Joni has been pulled into the family conference. Nic and Jules are trying to remain as calm as possible. Nic slugs gulp of wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, guys, we understand why you'd be curious about your biological father. That's totally natural.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But why didn't you tell us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because we knew you'd be upset.

dialogues.speaker: WE'RE NOT UPSET
dialogues.text: Jules calms her riled-up partner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey... (to Joni; expressing her upset more calmly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We just wish you'd have included us in your thinking. But what's done is done. You met him, and now you guys can move on--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sheepish)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually... (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to see him again.

dialogues.speaker: JULES LASER
dialogues.text: You do?!                         You do?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Laser)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I was gonna tell you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa! Whoa! No. No way. (regaining dominance)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody is seeing anyone until we meet him! Joni looks at Laser.   They knew this would happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 43 Nic and Jules do a post-mortem as they floss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I get it. He's their biological father and all that crap but it still feels really shitty. Like we're not enough or something, you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course I know. I don't want to time-share our kids with someone. Especially when it's Joni's last summer home. No way. When Jules leaves the room Nic pulls a clump of long, wet hair out of the sink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, Jules! The plumber was just here! Nic throws the clump of hair in the trash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting tactical)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, we need to be smart about this. If we act like grubby bitches, we're just gonna make it worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's just kill him with kindness and put it to bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm with you, honey. (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna get through this, okay? Nic smiles.   She loves when Jules shows confidence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, chicken. The women bump fists.   They have a plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you too, pony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 45 Paul rides slowly down the street, checking addresses. He pulls over and cuts his engine in front of the Allgood ho

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. ALLGOOD FRONT DOOR
dialogues.text: 47 Paul rings the bell. Waits. The door opens and Nic and Jules are there smiling with "kill him with kindness" fac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul! It is so great to meet you. I'm Nic. This is Jules. Paul shakes their hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, great to meet you two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope the traffic wasn't too bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I've got my bike so...I just sort of weave through. Nic clocks the motorcycle, stifles the impulse to judge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great.   Well, come on in. As they enter, Paul holds out a bottle of wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is for you. I don't know if you guys like wine... Nic takes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you kidding? We love it. (checking the label)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And a Petit Syrah. What a treat! Let me get some glasses. Nic leaves Paul by the stairs with Jules. Little silence. Jules steals a look at him, unable to contain her curiosi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beautiful house.    How long you guys lived here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost ten years. Wait, has it been that long? (rambling nervously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We moved right after Laser broke his leg, I remember that because we had a ramp for a while, so that would have been...ten, no, nine? No, ten years this fall. Paul nods, smiling at her nervousness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Laser and Joni enter. Joni lights up when she sees Paul. Jules watches Paul hug her. Uncomfortable, she heads for

dialogues.speaker: THE KITCHEN --
dialogues.text: Jules finds Nic's pouring herself a sizable glass of wine

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not okay)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Fine. Jules feels her inner co-dependent swelling in her chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go easy on the wine, hon.   It's day time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. And same goes for the micro- managing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 48 Everyone sits at the picnic table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope the food's okay. Joni told us you own a restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The food's great. Can't go wrong with salmon and corn. Nic finishes a glass of wine as Jules takes note. NIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Paul, did you always know you wanted to be in food-services industry? Paul smiles at Nic, trying to disarm her. PAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I always liked food. NIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I was asking because I remember reading in your file, back when we were looking for, you know, sperm, anyway, you said you were studying international relations. PAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. Wow, that was a long time ago. Yeah, I was considering it, but then I dropped out of school. JONI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You dropped out of college? PAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it wasn't my thing. NIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (squinching) No?    Why's that? PAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It just seemed like a massive waste of money after a while. I mean, I wasn't "doing" anything. I was just sitting on my ass listening to people spout off ideas I could've just as easily learned reading a book. Paul sees that his little rant may be alienating the moms PAUL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not saying higher learning uniformly sucks. I mean, college is great for some people. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAUL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joni, I'm sure you're gonna love it. That's just me. I'm just weird that way. (beat) Which is probably why I ended up in the food-services industry. LASER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See what he did there, mom? You said "food-services industry," then he said "food-services industry..." NIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I got it, Laser. Thanks. (apropos of nothing) So, Paul, what about your social life? PAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My social life? NIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, are you married, divorced, seeing anyone? JONI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom! NIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?   We're getting to know Paul. PAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, never been married or divorced. I date a little, but I'm just kind of focused on my work right now. NIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Paul wants a break from the heat. PAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, how'd you guys meet? Jules smiles, embarrassed.   Nic jumps in. NIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We met at UCLA. I was a resident in the ER and Jules had an emergency. JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My tongue went numb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? THUD!   We turn to see Laser, pounding his head on the ta JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laser, that's not nice. LASER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's not nice is subjecting your kids to the same story 1000 times! PAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignoring Laser) What happened to your tongue? JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I just lost all the feeling in my face and tongue and I thought I might gag and then, you know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Choke?    Die?... JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...exactly... NIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well it was pretty clear to me she was just having an anxiety attack and she'd be fine. PAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what'd you do for her? NIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gave her a Vallium. Tried to get her to relax, talk, move her tongue around. LASER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, that's gross! JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignoring Laser, to Nic) Actually, she started teasing me and that really helped. NIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was trying to distract you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. And it worked. You were really funny. NIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were really pretty. Nic reaches over and caresses Jules' hand.   Joni rolls h eyes, embarrassed. JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So that's it. My tongue started working again. NIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we've been glued at the hip ever since. PAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a great story. JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beaming) We like it. Laser and Joni share a look. PAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Nic, I know you're a doctor. How `bout you, Jules? What do you do? Jules never likes this question. JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I, you know, I studied architecture in college... PAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right... JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I'm not an architect. I mean I was on my way to becoming one. But I quit before the kids were born. PAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that happens... JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When they got a little older, I started a Balinese furniture import business...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right on. JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.   But that didn't work out. PAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, business aren't easy-- JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I'm in the process of starting a new business. PAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good for you. What kind? JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landscape design... (before he can respond) But not like a gardener! I mean, yes, there's a gardening component to it, but the real work is to create unique, eco-friendly outdoor spaces that harmonize with the surrounding environment. Do you know what I mean? PAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely. In Nic's mind, Jules is drowning in verbiage.   So she ju in to save her. NIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Paul, did Joni tell you about her graduation speech? PAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, she didn't. NIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was incredible. So full of wisdom and hope... (turning to her Joni) Hon, go get it. I'm sure he'd love to hear it... JONI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (blushing) No, mom, I'm sure he wouldn't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure he would.   Come on.   Go get it... JONI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting upset) No, it's okay... NIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweetie, don't be embarrassed. JONI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not embarrassed!   Jesus!     Give it a rest already! This outburst stuns Nic into silence. Her daughter has ne spoken to her like this. Laser stands up. LASER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get the ice-cream. JONI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (standing up) I'll help you. Joni and Laser leave the room. Nic pours herself the last Paul's Petit Syrah. Jules smiles, covering her anxiety. JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) Honey, that's your forth glass. NIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, it's my third.    But thanks for counting. Paul turns to Jules, trying to revive the mood. PAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I was just thinking. You know, I bought this place last year and the backyard's a wreck. Would you be interested in working on it? JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (insecure) Oh, that's okay. PAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, seriously. I don't have time to work on it myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. That's really sweet. Why don't you think about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?  I just did. (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, if you're not up for it that's okay--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (jumping on it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! I am! (getting excited)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm up for it!... Jules smiles at Nic: "Isn't this great?   My first client Nic looks less than pleased. OMITTED. 49

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 50 Nic pushes a cart piled high with gardening supplies. Jul grabs a couple BAGS of fertilizer, throws them on top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I'm just saying, the plan was to limit his involvement--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're unbelievable. You're all over me about getting clients, I finally get one and you're--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not just a client, Jules.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's our sperm donor! Have you ever heard the phrase "Don't Shit Where You Eat?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, and I think it's disgusting. The two separate, go down separate isles.     When they r Nic is contrite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. He just seemed sort of...self-satisfied to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jules grabs the olive branch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, he was working the whole "alternative" thing pretty hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mimicking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "I just need to get outside and `do' things, not sit on my ass and learn. But that's just me. I'm weird that way." They both laugh.    Nic's funny sometimes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 51 Jules drives slowly up the hill looking for Paul's addres She sees the house and pulls in the driveway next to an o truck and a motorcycle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 52 Jules and Paul walk through Paul's backyard, evaluating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...We could do a kind of a Secret Garden thing with trellises and topiary... (clocking his face)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...or something more Asian, minimal, with a rock garden feel. It's up to you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Personally, I'm tired of minimal. I'm into more is more. Let's not try to tame the space. I think it would look great all lush and overgrown and fecund...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fecund?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, you know, fertile...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I love that word. You just don't hear it that often. (thinking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More is more. Yeah. Let's do that. Jules is staring at Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.text: Oh god.   Okay. Hit me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you die do you want to be buried or cremated?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's your question?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to be cremated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I'd rather be buried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? That's just taking up more space in the earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, something about the idea of being burned into this chalky powder and sprinkled--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you care?   You won't even be conscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's true. I guess I just want to be in a place where people can visit me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (growing animated)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But why?! You'll be dead! You won't even know they're there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 78 Joni and Sasha are at a table eating dinner. Tanya has temporarily joined them. Sasha checks out Tanya's oversiz African bead necklace. Joni watches Paul charm customers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, I love your necklace!   Where'd you get it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, some flea market--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In Africa? TANYA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, more like Pasadena. SASHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's really awesome. Paul saunters up to the table and stands behind Sasha. mindlessly places his hand on Sasha's shoulder. PAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry guys, I need to steal Tanya back now. Sasha clocks Paul's hand. She carefully and without looki back places her hand on top of his. SASHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's okay, Paul. TANYA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting up) Well ladies, it was fun talking with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You too. Paul pulls his hand away from Sasha's and walks off with Tanya. Sasha turns to Joni. SASHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I'm sorry but your donor daddy is giving me the sex vibe. JONI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No he's not. He wouldn't do that. SASHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?    He's not my dad. JONI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God Sasha, that's totally gross! Not everybody wants to have sex with you, okay? Especially when you act like a slut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well it makes you seem insecure and desperate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not insecure and desperate! I'm just a normal sexual person! And maybe you'd get that if you weren't so uptight!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you.    I'm not uptight!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 79 Nic and Jules dine with their friends, JOEL and STELLA. Nic's drinking like a fish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god, these heirloom tomatoes are insane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joni brought some home from Paul's garden the other day. They were huge! Nic tightens at the mention of Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, the kids have been spending time with him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah, they're spending all kinds of quality time together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (senses the sarcasm)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's great they like him so much.   You know, you hear these stories about kids meeting their donors and the guys end up being nothing like they were on paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, everyone's getting along famously. Apparently Paul can do no wrong... Nic grabs a passing waiter by the arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIC (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we get another bottle of the Seavey Cabernet? Jules gives Nic a look.   Joel and Stella feel the tensio between them. STELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, have you guys tried those AГ§ai fruit packs? JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but they're pushing them like crack at Whole Foods. STELLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.    Joel's addicted. JOEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I do is I throw one in the blender with some bananas, frozen strawberries and hemp milk and I'll tell you, it's sensational. Nic slaps her forehead. NIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, just fucking kill me... Everyone stiffens.   Jules is embarrassed. JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey... NIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry guys, but I just can't, with the fucking hemp milk and the organic farming and heirloom tomatoes. (mocking-voice) "Oh no, don't throw that in the trash, no man, you gotta throw that into the composting bin so the fucking worms can shit all over it and turn it into glorious multch and we can all feel better about ourselves." God! What a bunch of bullshit! Nic takes a big swallow from her glass.   Jules windshiel wipes Nic's forearm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about some green tea, honey... Nic slams her glass on the table.   Explodes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what, Jules?! I like my wine! Okay? So fucking sue me! And fyi, red wine has a chemical called Resveratrol in it, which has been proven to significantly extend human lifespan!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, if you drink a thousand bottles a day!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you. Nic storms off.   Jules turns to Joel and Stella, ashen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 80 Jules walks over to the bar. Nic is sitting in the corner

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is going on with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This whole Paul thing is driving me crazy! I feel like he's taking over my family. Jules tries to bring it down.   She yells in hushed tones

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. He's not!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nerves fraying)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay! Okay. I'm sorry.      I'm just exhausted...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you need to take some time off and recharge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (self-pitying) Sure, and who's gonna pay for that? Jules looks pissed off, and hurt. NIC (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm sorry, I just feel like I'm carrying the whole load here. JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because that's the way you like it! That's the way you keep control! This is Jules' break-point. NIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh come on! You hated it when I worked! You wanted me at home, taking care of the kids. You wanted a wife! NIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is just not true! JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't trust any of those nannies! And you sure as hell didn't back my career! NIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? I just helped you start another business! JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, so you can feel better about yourself! NIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, so you can feel better about yourself! JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you even attracted to me anymore? The BARTENDER holds out the bottle of Cabernet. BARTENDER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you still want this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Just the check please.

dialogues.speaker: JULES AND PAUL
dialogues.text: 81 Fucking again in his bedroom. Jules writhes beneath him, eyes closed.   Paul seems to be in some kind of zone. He stares at her, enthralled.

dialogues.speaker: POST
dialogues.text: 82 Jules and Paul lie naked in the bed. Jules slithers aroun the covers, stoned on post-coital endorphins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, I feel so drugular right now. (sitting up quickly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really want a cigarette! Do you have any? I haven't had a cigarette since Laser was born. Do you smoke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes. But I don't have any here. Want me to run to the store?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bouncing off the walls)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Wait, no. Don't.     Sorry. Jules pops up on her knees, getting in his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think I'm just like some sad- sack middle-aged lesbian?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, that's it. I was trying to figure out how to describe you to my friends. Thank you. Jules punches his arm, mock hurt. They start rough-housin Then kissing. Then the phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to get that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I want to get this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul grabs a handful of Jules' ass. Jules throws her leg over Paul and climbs up for another round. Suddenly, Joni voice echoes through the machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Paul. It's Joni. I just wanted to apologize for my friend, Sasha. I was really embarrassed when she put her hand on your-- Paul grabs the receiver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Joni.     I'm here... Jules visibly recoils.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, don't worry about your friend. Jules pales. She mouths: "What are you doing?!"    Paul gesticulates: "I'm sorry!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Honestly. I didn't even notice... Jules throws on her clothes and starts to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Joni?     Can you hold on a second? Paul grabs Jules' wrist and mouths "wait!"   Jules rips h arm free and walks out.

dialogues.speaker: MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: 83 walks outside and is stunned to find Luis already back fr Home Depot, sneezing and wiping his nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you go to Home Depot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.   I just got back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was fast!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, no lines. His look of confusion trips off her paranoia.      She's convinced he knows everything. JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that look?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What look? JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The look you're giving me right now! LUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's no look.     That just my face. JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm not gonna play this game with you! You need to keep your judgements to yourself! LUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Senora, I didn't give no looks! JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't ask you why you keep blowing your nose constantly! I mean, if you have a drug problem that's your business... LUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have no drug problem! I have the allergies! JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why are you a gardener?! Luis stares at Jules, innocent. LUIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cause I love the flowers. JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, this isn't gonna work. I'll pay you through the end of the day and then we're done. Jules walks past a totally confused Luis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 84 Jules lies on her side. Nic shuffles to get to close to h Jules moves away, still pissed at her. Nic realizes she needs to make amends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 85 The family sits in silence, having breakfast.     Nic loo around the table, feeling like a pariah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I know you've all been enjoying your time with Paul. And I know I haven't been as open to him as everyone else and this has caused some...friction...between us. But I'd like to try and change that... Everyone keeps eating, uncommitted.   "And...?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I was thinking. Maybe it would be nice if we all had dinner at his house sometime. That way, I could get to know him a little better, and I could see all the good work mom's been doing with his backyard. Nic looks at Jules and smiles. Everyone nods.     They recognize this is a big step for Nic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 88 Paul walks out to check on Jules. She's sweating her ass off, shlepping stacks of heavy mulch across the yard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's it going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, let me help. Paul takes some of her load and together they transport t sod to the other side of the yard. Neither know what to s Paul stares at her, waiting for her lead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't be doing this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm married...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and the kids...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, and I love Nic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know... They stare at each other and we cut to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 89 Paul and Jules lie in bed. Jules looks nauseated.   Paul offers her a pack of smokes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got you some cigarettes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignoring him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, what's wrong with me? I shouldn't have fired Luis like that. That was totally wrong...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. Don't be so hard on yourself. Things get messy sometimes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That wasn't messy. That was fucked up. I'm totally fucked up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I'm really falling for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul, don't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 90 Jules takes a shower, washing off the evidence.   She loo nauseated by her lack of willpower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 87 Tanya walks over to Paul who's on his computer. She flops the couch next to him. He doesn't look up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty good night. That table had like 5 bottles of wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow.    Yeah. Good night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joni's pretty. She's got some of your genes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think she looks more like her mom actually. But thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's cute seeing you in dad mode.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. (lowering voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It makes me want to fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (uncomfortable)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... Tanya moves imperceptibly closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been missing our sleep-overs. Paul finally stops what he's doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it's been a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to meet up later? Paul hesitates.   He doesn't know how to say no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanya, you're so sexy and beautiful, but I don't think we should do that anymore. Tanya's face drops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, our thing is really fun and easy, but...I don't want to be 50 and still "hanging out." You know? If I really want a family then I have to stop getting in these situations that don't go anywhere. Paul just looks at her.   Tanya gets it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (welling up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Paul knows enough to say nothing.      Tanya gets up and off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you. Paul sits there, feeling like an asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 91 The family packs into the Volvo to head to Paul's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 92 Paul gets dinner ready with Joni and Laser as his sous-ch Both kids seem really jazzed to be cooking with him.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BACKYARD -EVENING
dialogues.text: Jules tours Nic around the backyard, looking a little fre out as she shows her the work she's been doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna do some planting over there so it won't look so bare...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks great, honey. Very indigenous. I'm so proud of you. Nic kisses Jules spontaneously. Jules looks nauseous agai They head back up the stairs, toward Paul's house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, so how's that guy Luis working out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I had to fire him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, he had a drug problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa.   What kind of drugs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blow, I think...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 93 Nic flips through Paul's album collection, including Joni Mitchell's Blue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 94 Everyone digs into the meal, enjoying themselves.   Espec Nic, who's committed to redeeming herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Nic, I think you're gonna love this `98 Screaming Eagle. NIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what, I think I'm gonna stick with water tonight. But thank you so much. The Allgoods look at Nic: this is a first. NIC (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, Paul, this steak is delicious. What's the seasoning? PAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just mist it with a little truffle oil. Nic looks at Jules and smiles in full overcompensation mo NIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a good idea. We should try that. Right, honey? JULES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taken aback by Nic's cheerfulness) Mmm-hmmm. NIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it's done to perfection. PAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So it's not too rare? NIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's perfect. Juicy. Tender. Exactly what rare's supposed to be. PAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. A lot of people in the restaurant order a steak rare and they freak out at the slightest sight of red. NIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ugh, isn't that annoying? That happens to me all the time when I'm grilling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't people know that rare means red? NIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right?!   It means bloody! PAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly! They should see what rare looks like in Argentina. The cow's practically still mooing. Laser chuckles at Paul's joke, then reigns it in.   Joni to insert herself in the conversation. JONI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really want to go to Argentina. Buenos Aires is supposed to be-- NIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) ...So Paul, I was checking out your album collection over there. Quite the eclectic mix... PAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks... NIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't meet too many straight guys who love Joni Mitchell. Joni glares at Nic: stop being such a Paul hog. PAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, you a Joni Mitchell fan? NIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smug) Not really. We just named our daughter after her. PAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool. Right on... NIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your favorite Joni album? PAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I have to go with "Blue." Nic raises her hand in a testify.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAUL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?   You too? They high-five across the table. NIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God, I probably spent half of high school in my room crying to that album. That record kills me. PAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, it never lets up, you got "River," "California..." NIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "A Case of You..." PAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "All I Want.." NIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmm!! Nic pulls her hands to her chest, shuts her eyes...and st to sing. NIC (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am on a lonely road and I am traveling traveling, traveling, traveling/Looking for something, what can it be/Oh I hate you some, I hate you some/I love you some Oh I love you/when I forget about me... Jules, Paul and the kids watch, open-mouthed as Nic soldi on, skipping ahead to another verse. NIC (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to talk to you/I want to shampoo you/I want to renew you again and again/Applause, applause/ Life is our cause/When I think of your kisses/My mind see-saws... Nic takes a breath. Just as Paul's about to say something Nic resumes her unfortunate solo. NIC (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you see/do you see/do you see how you hu-urt me baby/so I hurt you too/then we both get/soo-ooo- ooo blue...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nic stops, eyes still closed. She's connected to a part o herself she rarely lets herself visit. The moment is punctured by her smart-ass 15-year-old son. LASER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't quit your day job, mom. PAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. It's hard enough to open your heart in this world. Don't make it harder. LASER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right. (to Nic; contrite) I'm sorry, mom. Nic looks at Paul.    Stunned.   Then looks at Jules and to Paul. NIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like this guy. Paul looks at Joni. PAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't tell me you were named after Joni M. JONI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just so dorky. I don't really like to bring it up. PAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's cool. NIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting up) Hey Paul. Where's your bathroom? PAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just around there. On her way to the loo, Nic turns back to Paul. NIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what? I think I will try some of that Screaming Eagle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 95 Nic washes her hands at the sink. Something catches her e She lifts Paul's hairbrush from the shelf in front of her examines it. She reaches into the bristles and pulls out. A few strands of long red hair. Nic pales.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Nic on her knees in Paul's shower, pulling a clump of tel tale red hair from the drain.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Nic skulks out of the bathroom.   She looks out and b-lin for the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Nic pulling pillows off Paul's bed.   Her look tells us s found hair here as well.

dialogues.speaker: THEN WE CUT TO
dialogues.text: Nic sitting back down at the table. She looks drained. Nobody notices. The sound drops out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul and Jules talking comfortably. Joni and Laser chiming in, smiling, one big happy family.

dialogues.speaker: REVERSE ONTO NIC
dialogues.text: Totally disconnected. Shell-shocked. She wants to scream but it feels like she's trapped in cement. Things slow wa down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 97 Nic and Jules perform their nightly ablutions.   Jules is sonic-caring her teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through the sonic buzz)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you and Paul seemed to get on like gang-busters...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're sleeping with him, aren't you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (freaked)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Nic turns to her, eyes red with anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just be honest with me. Don't make me feel crazier than I feel right now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is this coming from?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found your hair in his drain!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (scrambling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? I was working.    I got dirty so I took a shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah?   You take a nap, too? Jules pauses a second too long.   The jig is up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 98 The truth has come out.   Nic is so angry she's calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you in love with him?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, are you straight now?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It has nothing to do with that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've just felt so cut off from you lately...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, right, so it's my fault!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Who said anything about fault? Just listen to me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm listening!   What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just needed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?   To be fucked?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, appreciated!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's always what I'm not doing for you, isn't it? Well here's what I don't to you. I don't work out my issues by fucking other people! Nic starts heading for the door.    Jules follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not just "other people!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you had to go fuck our sperm donor! You couldn't have picked a more painful way to hurt me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need water! My mouth is dry! Nic opens the door. There's Joni and Laser, looking devastated. They've been listening to the whole thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 99 Jules wakes up looking crusty from a rough night on the couch. She looks like she hasn't slept at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 100 Jules enters and walks over to her sleeping son.   She ge nudges him awake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Laser.     Honey? Laser turns over, semi-conscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? She sits down on his bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, I know you and Joni heard what's going on. I just want you to know that what happened with Paul and me is over. There's nothing going on now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you might need some time to process your feelings around this, but I just want you to know that I'm here for you if you want to talk about anything. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there anything you want to talk about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (leave my room)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fighting the impulse to push it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay then. Go back to sleep. Jules pats her son and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 101 Jules enters and touches Joni's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joni?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we just--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said I don't want to talk to you!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.   I'm sorry. Jules slowly retreats to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 102 Jules drinks coffee at the table. Nic walks in, dressed f work. Jules looks at her, wanting to "process." But Nic isn't in the mood. She grabs a banana from a bowl and wal out. Jules feels like a leper. OMITTED. 103

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 104 We can tell Joni's been crying and downloading the whole thing to Sasha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's Nic doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a wreck. I've never seen her like this before. Joni's cell rings. She gets off the bed, looks at the pho It's a picture of Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it him...? Joni nods gravely, answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cold)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 105 Paul's walking through rows of swiss chard, cell phone to ear. Conversation Intercut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Joni, how you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're such a phony. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You act like you're so groovy and together but you're not. You're a shitty person!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With my mom?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, can I just come and talk with you--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with you?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joni...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't call me anymore. Joni hangs up and start crying.    Sasha hugs her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 106 Sweaty, nauseous with remorse, Paul turns around to find fetching young Brooke, waiting for him with a wicker bask of huge cucumbers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Paul, look at these cukes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul holds up his hand at her.   This girl symbolizes eve bad choice he's ever made. He gives her the universal, "Leave Me Alone" gesture.   B looks embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 107 Jules sits on a lawn chair smoking a cigarette.    Her ce rings. She answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 108 Paul walks down the street, wigging out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, it's me. I just talked to Joni. Conversation intercut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god, I'm so sorry.   I should have called you. Jules sucks a big, anxious drag off a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nic saw my hair in your bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, it's all out in the open now. Let's make this happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm serious. Fuck it. Let's get the kids together and do this thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul, come on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! I'm sick of this life. I want a family. I'm ready--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eye rolling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, Paul! I'm gay! Jules tosses the phone away from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 109 Joni and Sasha stand at the makeshift "bar".    Joni's do several Tequila shots quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slow down, tiger. Across the room, Joni spots Jai chatting with a WAIFY GIR a sundress. Joni drops one more Tequila shot and walks up to Jai and Waify girl, interrupting them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like the scruff.   It's sexy. Waify girl juts out her hip territorially.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, `scuuuse me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're excused. (then back to Jai)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, can I talk to you? Joni leads Jai to a private corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leans in and kisses Jai. And Jai actually returns the kiss. And it's completely sweet and intimate. But then the kiss starts to morph as Joni's energy turns manic, intense, less romantic than emotionally needy. We Jai start to pull away. But Joni keeps holding him, wanti more. Finally, Jai breaks off the kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joni...Joni...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joni looks pained, embarrassed.      Jai keeps holding he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm fine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joni pulls free and escapes, leaving a confused Jai in he wake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 110 Jules walks in to find Nic, awake, in bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just getting another pillow.   The couch is kind of saggy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is your back okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jules perks up: is this an invitation to share the bed ag

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a little ache-y.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should take some Advil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess not. Suddenly they hear bumping and loud footsteps downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 111 Jules walks downstairs to find Joni stumbling toward her bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.    How was the party? Joni tries to avert her mom's questioning gaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How big was it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Medium...ish... Jules takes in the glassy look in her daughter's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you drunk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Nic enters from the stairs, having caught the last piece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope you had a designated driver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?    I'm not drunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you seem drunk to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, you should know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (furious; incredulous)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you just say to me?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to bed. Joni starts to leave.   Nic grabs her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you're not!    I'm not done talking to you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laser opens his door and watches the scene progress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want from me?! I did everything you wanted! I got all A's! I got in everywhere I applied! Now you can show everybody what a perfect family you have!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't talk to your mom like that! Joni spins to face Jules.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're really gonna tell me how to act? Now?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I'm still your mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever... Jules reaches out and Joni backs away, sickened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't touch me! Joni heads for her room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so sick of both of you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 112 The sun rises on this formerly happy home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 113 Jules wakes up on the couch.   Sits up.   Rubs her aching

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 114 Joni packs for college. The room is littered with half- filled packing boxes. She picks up a pile of clothes from the corner and sees the farmer's hat Paul gave her. She p it aside, not sure what to do with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 115 Paul looks around his newly landscaped yard.     It looks abandoned than revived.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 116 The family has their last supper - before Joni leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you pack that lamp I gave you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we can always get stuff up there, too, if you need it, I mean if the room's dark or you need extra bedding...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going to Siberia, mom. Jules looks at the family unit, misty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe this is our last dinner together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God, are you gonna cry? Jules looks at her son, fed up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish you were gay.    You'd be so much more sensitive. The doorbell rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's probably Sasha.    I'll get it. Joni runs to the door.   Opens it. It's not Sasha.   It's

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shocked)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I needed to talk to you before you left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing to talk about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want to apologize again for what happened. I can't tell you how much I regret it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 117 Joni walks out for privacy, closes the door behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So like, everything that happened between us. What was that? Was that just bullshit?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it wasn't bullshit at all. I know I don't seem credible right now but I really care about you... Paul struggles to keep his emotions in check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and I just hope someday we'll be able to see each other again. Do you think that could maybe happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... Joni looks down welling up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wish you could've been...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Joni chokes back tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better... Paul and Joni look up at each other when the door suddenl flings open. Nic is there, fuming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got some balls, mister!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nic, hold on... Nic walks toward he and Joni.   Joni ducks back inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you hold on! Let me tell you something, you really hurt my kids!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, they're kinda my...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting him off)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! They're not. This is not your family. This is my family! You're just a fucking interloper... Jules joins Nic, concerned things are getting out of hand

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't mean to hurt anyone... Paul and Jules share a look as Nic deals the coup de grac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you want a family so much, go out and make one of your own! Nic heads back inside and slams the door behind her. Paul stand alone, spinning. After a moment he spontaneous looks back into the house. Laser is staring at him throug the window. Their eyes lock and Paul give Laser a contrit smile. That's the final straw for Laser. He grabs his pla and walks out of view. Reeling, Paul heads for his motorcycle. He gets on the bi helmet in hand. Turns on the ignition. He picks up the helmet and pauses, shaking in the hell of his own making. Losing it, he hurls the helmet at the motorcycle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 118 Laser, Joni and Nic watch "Locked Up Abroad" Jules walks front of them, picks up the remote and turns off the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to say something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone sits up.   Jules acts stoic but she's wrecked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, it's no big secret your mom and are in hell right now. Bottom line...marriage is hard...really fucking hard. Just two people, slogging through the shit, year after year, getting older, changing. It's a fucking marathon, okay?! Everyone is silenced by the outpouring.   Jules soldiers

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So sometimes you're together so long, you just stop seeing the other person. You just see weird projections of your own junk. And instead of talking to each other, you go off the rails, and act grubby and make stupid choices. Which is what I did. And I feel sick about it because I love you guys and I love your mom and that's the truth. Sometimes you hurt the ones you love the most. I don't know why. Maybe if I read more Russian novels I would... Nic looks down, overwhelmed by it all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, I just wanted to say how sorry I am about what I did and that I hope you'll forgive me eventually. (awkward)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. And, without further ado, Jules hands the remote back to Laser and departs the field. Everyone's silenced by Jules rambling apologia, especially Nic. OMITTED. 119

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 120 Joni wakes up. She looks around her room. There's nothing on the walls. The floor is covered with boxes taped and labeled. It's time to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 121 Nic and Jules stuff the last of Joni's things in the back their station wagon. Laser and Joni bring the last of the boxes out of the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 122 The Allgoods are on the road, heading to college. OMITTED. 123

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 124 The station wagon passes through the campus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 125 As they drive past buildings and dorms, Joni sees STUDENT swarming the campus. She takes it all in, nervous, excite Nic and Jules steal looks back at Joni, feeling her nervousness, wishing they could take it away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 126 The Allgoods pull up to the curb, get out.   Laser piles Joni's boxes on his skateboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 127 Laser dollies Joni's boxes though the corridor and while and the moms follow behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nic and Jules follow Joni to the door.    They all jam up the threshold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys, it's okay.   I got it. Nic and Jules get the hint. They move back and Joni enter the room alone. Nic and Jules quietly turn and leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 128 Joni stands among her bags and boxes looking around. She goes into her suitcase and pulls out her linens. She star making her bed but suddenly stops mid way. She stares out toward the hallway. Finally she moves to the doorway and looks out.    She re her family isn't there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 129 Joni exits, looking around to find her family. The statio wagon is gone. She looks panicked. Her pace quickens as s makes her way down a hill toward the road. Finally Joni sees the Volvo heading towards her. The car pulls over to the curb and everyone gets out.   J looks vulnerable. She tries to cover it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you go?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had to move the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We wouldn't leave without saying goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give us some credit. And suddenly, everyone realizes...this is it. It's time t say goodbye. First Laser comes up and hugs Joni.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's gonna be weird not having you at home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry to leave you alone with them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay.     I can handle it. Laser backs up. Then the moms both come up and hug Joni, tears streaming down their faces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys, come on... (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'll talk to you soon. Joni tries to detach from the hug. But her moms won't let go. They keep holding her and crying. Slowly, their tears begin to break Joni down. Trapped in their loving embrace, Joni's feelings rise up, unbidden, overpowering her. She starts crying. The moms hold her tighter, which makes her cry even harde Soon she's sobbing in her mothers' arms, as all the press resentment and anger she's felt starts seeping out of her Nic and Jules feel their daughter letting go.   They hold tight to comfort her. They keep holding her until a calm sets in. The hug breaks apart. Nic pushes the hair from Joni's fac Joni gives her moms one last smile. Laser, Jules and Nic get back in the car. Joni stands watching as they drive off and her new life begins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 130 The family drives home. Jules is at the wheel. Nic's in t passenger seat, eyes red and puffy. Laser's in the back. No one speaks, everyone's lost in their own worlds.   Fin Laser breaks the spell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think you guys should break up. A long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No?   Why's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you're too old. Both Nic and Jules crack smiles. Their son's rudeness is unsurpassed. But then his words have an unexpected gravit

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Laser. Jules, disarmed and slightly smiling, reaches over and pu her hand on Nic's leg. She gives it a gentle squeeze and doesn't let go. Nic looks over to Jules, finally disarmed Nic reaches for Jules' hand and holds it tight.   Nic and Jules look at each other, and then away. Laser watches his moms holding hands from the back seat. Their small gesture is what he needed. He smiles to himse grateful for a sign.
